questions.question_text:
An online retailer uses 200 cloud-hosted virtual machines (VMs). Currently, the configuration of each VM is performed manually. To support the growth strategy of the retailer, the retailer starts to automatically scale the VMs to meet demand and uses Ansible for configuration management.

Which action must be performed in Ansible to meet the requirements before automation is performed?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Dynamic inventory allows Ansible to query external sources to obtain the list of hosts to manage, which is essential for environments where the number of VMs can change frequently, such as in an auto-scaling scenario. This way, Ansible can dynamically discover and manage the VMs without needing to manually update the inventory file.

Selected Answer: C
I think C

choices.C: Set up and configure Ansible Tower.
choices.B: Add each VM to the .ini inventory file.

questions.question_text:
An engineer must deploy Cisco ACI in two data centers with a multisite configuration. The deployment must support a central management console for multiple data centers host multiple applications and support hardware and virtual clouds.

Which product must be used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is right

Selected Answer: C
C is correct .

Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator (NDO) is designed to manage and orchestrate multiple ACI sites, providing a central management console for multisite deployments. It allows for consistent policy management and operational visibility across multiple data centers

Selected Answer: C
I think C

Selected Answer: C
This must be NDO as they refer to product - it would be classic cisco if it was just Nexus Dashboard though.

Selected Answer: B
Only syntax that makes sense is B.
9300-EX/-FX switches (incl 93180) support source vlan in both directions:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/93x/system-management/b-cisco-nexus-9000-series-nx-os-system-management-configuration-guide-93x/b-cisco-nexus-9000-series-nx-os-system-management-configuration-guide-93x_chapter_011011.html#concept_mhj_bxb_qhb

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.

//IMG//


An engineer must implement an Application Performance Monitoring (APM) for the production servers on the Cisco Nexus 93180 Series Switch-based infrastructure in datacenter 1. The APM solution must meet these requirements:
• It must copy all inbound and outbound production traffic.
• It must support real-time telemetry.

Which configuration must be used on datacenter 1 switches to meet these objectives?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It is D. You have to enter in role name sangroup, after in vsan policy deny and last entre "no permit vsan 15-20"

Selected Answer: C
C. vsan policy deny vsan 15-20
This command will deny access to the specified VSANs for the users in the sangroup role

Selected Answer: D
The following example removes the permission for this role to perform commands for vsan 15 to 20.
switch(config-role-vsan)# no permit vsan 15-20

Selected Answer: C
I think it's C - as you configure it VSAN policy deny..

Selected Answer: A
L2 protocols are configured on interface policy group
